Approved For Release 2011/02/24: CIA-RDP88-00434R000400920001-1 Directory of Chinese Officials and Organizations LDA 86-12513 November 1986 Approved For Release 2011/02/24: CIA-RDP88-00434R000400920001-1 Approved For Release 2011/02/24: CIA-RDP88-00434R000400920001-1 This publication is prepared for the use of US Government officials, and the format, coverage, and content are designed to meet their specific requirements. US Government officials may obtain additional copies of this document directly or through liaison channels from the Central Intelligence Agency. Requesters outside the US Government may obtain subscriptions to CIA publications similar to this one by addressing inquiries to: Document Expediting (DOCEX) Project Exchange and Gift Division Library of Congress Washington, D.C. 20540 or: National Technical Information Service 5285 Port Royal Road Springfield, VA 22161 Requesters outside the US Government not interested in subscription service may purchase specific publications either in paper copy or microform from: National Technical Information Service 5285 Port Royal Road Springfield, VA 22161 (To expedite service call the NTIS Order Desk (703) 487-4650) or: Photoduplication Service Library of Congress Washington, D.C. 20540 Approved For Release 2011/02/24: CIA-RDP88-00434R000400920001-1 Approved For Release 2011/02/24: CIA-RDP88-00434R000400920001-1 Directory of Chinese Officials and Organizations Information available as of 1 November 1986 was used in the preparation of this publication. LDA 86-12513 November 1986 Approved For Release 2011/02/24: CIA-RDP88-00434R000400920001-1 Approved For Release 2011/02/24: CIA-RDP88-00434R000400920001-1 PREFACE This directory identifies individuals who hold important positions in the People's Republic of China. Information was drawn primarily from Chinese press releases received through 1 November 1986. Included are the earliest and latest dates specifically identifying individuals in their positions. (Excep- tions are members of the Politburo and State Council, who are listed in their positions as of October 1986.) The names of females are followed by the letter f. Also included are a table of contents and indexes to organizations and personalities, the latter with Standard Telegraphic Codes, when available. The orthography adopted is the Pinyin system for the romanization of Chinese characters. When romanized versions of Uyghur, Zang, and other minority names are known, they are used; otherwise the Chinese phonetics of those names are rendered in Pinyin. This reference aid combines and supersedes the three earlier volumes in the series: National-Level Organizations (CR 85-12068, June 1985), Provin- cial Organizations (CR 86-11054, March 1986), and Scientific and Educa- tional Organizations (CR 85-10229, February 1985). Approved For Release 2011/02/24: CIA-RDP88-00434R000400920001-1 Approved For Release 2011/02/24: CIA-RDP88-00434R000400920001-1 PREFACE ................................................................................................................................................ Diplomatic and Consular Service Diplomatic posts in the United States, the United Nations, the Soviet Union, the United Kingdom, Canada, New Zealand, Aus- tralia, and Japan will have information published through third secretary and the military and assistant military attaches; all other diplomatic posts will have information published through first secretary and the military attache Approved For Release 2011/02/24: CIA-RDP88-00434R000400920001-1 Approved For Release 2011/02/24: CIA-RDP88-00434R000400920001-1 Approved For Release 2011/02/24: CIA-RDP88-00434R000400920001-1 Approved For Release 2011/02/24: CIA-RDP88-00434R000400920001-1 Date of Information Earliest Latest Afghanistan (Diplomatic relations established January 1955) Embassy, Kabul Ambassador ..................................................................
